text:
Glenview is a village in northeastern Illinois, USA. It is about north of downtown Chicago in Cook County, Illinois. According to the 2010 United States Census, the village population was 44,692.
History.
The village was named by a popular vote in 1895. It was incorporated as a village in 1899. There were 325 adults in Glenview that year.
For many years, it was home to the Naval Air Station Glenview, until the station was closed down and converted to a prairie park, a lake, and residential and commercial properties in the early 1990s.
Population.
The median age in 2010 was 45.5. There were 23,496 (52.6%) women, and
21,196 (47.4%) men. There were 14,818 households.
Climate.
The highest recorded temperature was in June 1988; the lowest recorded temperature was in January 1982.
